output: DANGEROUS: Attempts to recursively delete the entire filesystem starting from root. This will destroy the operating system and all data. Never run this command.
DANGEROUS: Recursively deletes all directories under root. Will destroy system and data. Catastrophic command.
DANGEROUS: Elevated recursive deletion of entire filesystem. Even more dangerous with sudo privileges.
DANGEROUS: Fork bomb that creates infinite processes, causing system freeze and potential crash. Denial of service attack.
DANGEROUS: Overwrites entire hard drive with zeros. Permanent data destruction. Unrecoverable.
DANGEROUS: Formats entire disk, destroying all data. Creates new filesystem, erasing everything.
DANGEROUS: Downloads and executes untrusted script. Could install malware, steal data, or compromise system.
DANGEROUS: Downloads and executes untrusted script with root privileges. Extreme security risk.
DANGEROUS: Makes critical system file world-writable. Allows any user to modify authentication. Major security vulnerability.
DANGEROUS: Makes entire filesystem world-writable. Complete security compromise. System unusable.
DANGEROUS: Changes ownership of entire filesystem. System will become unusable. Critical files inaccessible.
DANGEROUS: Redirects empty output to raw disk device. Can corrupt partition table and filesystem.
DANGEROUS: Attempts to move all root directories to null device. Would delete entire system.
DANGEROUS: Removes all Linux kernels. System will be unbootable. No recovery without external media.
DANGEROUS: Sends SIGKILL to all processes. Will crash system immediately. Potential data loss.
CAUTION: Changes root password. Could lock out legitimate admins. Requires careful consideration.
CAUTION: Edits sudoers file. Mistakes can lock out sudo access. Use with extreme care.
CAUTION: Stops SSH service. Will disconnect remote sessions. May lock out remote access.
CAUTION: Force pushes to git repository. Can overwrite others' work. Loss of commit history.
CAUTION: Removes all unused Docker resources. Deletes images, containers, networks. May affect other users.
CAUTION: Forcefully clears npm cache. May need to re-download packages. Temporary inconvenience.
CAUTION: Updates package lists with elevated privileges. Generally safe but review any warnings.
CAUTION: Upgrades system packages. Could introduce breaking changes. Review package list first.
CAUTION: Deletes single file. Ensure you have backups. Consider using trash instead.
SAFE: Lists directory contents with details. Read-only operation. No side effects.
SAFE: Prints current working directory. Read-only operation. Completely harmless.
SAFE: Changes directory. No destructive action. Navigation only.
SAFE: Displays file contents. Read-only operation. No modifications.
SAFE: Searches for text pattern in files. Read-only operation. No changes made.
SAFE: Finds files by name pattern. Read-only search. No execution or modification.
SAFE: Lists running processes. Information gathering only. No system changes.
SAFE: Shows disk usage. Read-only system information. Helpful for monitoring.
SAFE: Displays current username. Simple information query. No risk.
SAFE: Shows current date and time. Read-only operation. Harmless.
SAFE: Prints text to terminal. No file operations. Simple output.
SAFE: Shows command history. Read-only operation. May reveal sensitive commands in history.
SAFE: Opens manual page. Documentation access only. Educational.
SAFE: Shows path to executable. Information query. No execution.
SAFE: Lists environment variables. May show sensitive vars but read-only.
SAFE: Runs build script defined in package.json. Standard development command.
SAFE: Shows git repository status. Read-only operation. Version control query.
SAFE: Shows git commit history. Read-only operation. No repository changes.
SAFE: Runs test suite. Standard development command. Non-destructive.
CAUTION: Removes build artifacts. Generally safe but deletes generated files.
